data.chText: 侵犯他人身体（罪）；侵犯人身罪
data.enText: the crime of attacking sb physically

data.chText: 两人均被控侵犯他人身体罪。
data.enText: Both men were charged with assault.

data.chText: 很大数量的猥亵妇女罪没有举报。
data.enText: A significant number of indecent assaults on women go unreported.
the act of attacking a building, an area, etc. in order to take control of it

data.chText: 凌晨时分向首都发起了攻击。
data.enText: An assault on the capital was launched in the early hours of the morning.

data.chText: （向困难或危险事物发起的）冲击
data.enText: the act of trying to achieve sth that is difficult or dangerous

data.chText: 政府向失业发起新的攻势。
data.enText: The government has mounted a new assault on unemployment (= in order to reduce it) .

data.chText: 登山过程中有三人死亡。
data.enText: Three people died during an assault on the mountain (= while trying to climb it) .
an act of criticizing sb/sth severely

data.chText: 这份报纸对总统的攻击纯属无稽之谈。
data.enText: The paper's assault on the president was totally unjustified.

data.chText: 关闭机构的建议受到各方严厉批评。
data.enText: The suggested closures came under assault from all parties.

data.chText: 猛烈攻击，袭击，侵犯人身（尤指构成罪行）
data.enText: to attack sb violently, especially when this is a crime
He has been charged with assaulting a police officer.

data.chText: 近来这个地区有四名妇女遭到强奸猥亵。
data.enText: Four women have been sexually assaulted in the area recently.
to affect your senses in a way that is very unpleasant or uncomfortable

data.chText: 喧闹的摇滚乐直往我们耳朵里钻。
data.enText: Loud rock music assaulted our ears.

word_means: 猛烈攻击，袭击，侵犯人身
simple_means.memory_skill: as 加强 + sault〔= sult〕跳 → 跳起来扣杀 → 进攻

means: (向困难或危险事物发起的)冲击
猛烈攻击，袭击，侵犯人身(尤指构成罪行)

ex.chText: 这座城市遭到了敌人的轰炸。
ex.enText: This city was bombarded by the enemy.

ex.chText: 记者们向总统提出了许多有关其经济政策的问题。
ex.enText: Reporters bombarded the President with questions about his economic policy.

synonyms.bx: 指用炮弹、炸弹、导弹等连续地猛炸某处，也可以指大肆抨击某人。

ex.chText: 敌人向我们的战舰发起连续猛攻。

ex.enText: He was assailed by his political opponent.

synonyms.bx: 指对某人或某物连续地猛烈攻击或抨击。

ex.chText: 敌人突然对小镇发起猛烈攻击。
ex.enText: The enemy assaulted the small town.
The gang assaulted him with iron bars.

synonyms.bx: 语气比 assail 强, 指突然发起猛烈进攻或近身暴力攻击；也可以指严厉批评某人的观念、计划等。

ex.enText: The enemy attacked the village at night.

ex.chText: 她大胆的言论遭到保守派的抨击。
ex.enText: Her bold remarks were attacked by the conservatives.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指事先不发警告而向对方发动攻击，既可指发起武力攻击，也可以指进行言语攻击。

tr: a threatened or attempted physical attack by someone who appears to be able to cause bodily harm if not stopped
the crime of forcing a woman to submit to sexual intercourse against her will
close fighting during the culmination of a military attack

example: The editors of the left-leaning paper attacked the new House Speaker

tr: force (someone) to have sex against their will
example: The woman was raped on her way home at night

value.def: An assault by an army is a strong attack made on an area held by the enemy.

example.ex: The rebels are poised for a new assault on the government garrisons...
example.tran: 叛军准备好要对政府驻军发起新一轮的猛攻。

example.ex: Most US soldiers welcomed the ground assault when the order was finally given.
example.tran: 当命令最终下达的时候，大多数美军士兵都愿意发动地面进攻。

value.def: Assault weapons such as rifles are intended for soldiers to use in battle rather than for purposes such as hunting.
An assault on a person is a physical attack on them.

example.ex: The attack is one of a series of savage sexual assaults on women in the university area...
example.tran: 这次袭击是在大学校园内发生的一系列针对女性的野蛮性侵犯事件中的一起。

example.ex: At the police station, I was charged with assault.
example.tran: 在警察局，我被指控殴打他人。

value.tran: 人身攻击；殴打；（身体）侵犯

value.def: To assault someone means to physically attack them.

example.ex: The gang assaulted him with iron bars...
She may have been sexually assaulted by her killer.
example.tran: 她可能遭到过凶手的性侵犯。

value.def: An assault on someone's beliefs is a strong criticism of them.

example.ex: He leveled a verbal assault against his Democratic opponents.
example.tran: 他猛烈抨击其民主党对手。

trans: 性侵；性暴力；强奸；性侵犯；性侵害
冲锋枪；攻击步枪；突击步枪；战斗步枪；步枪
殴打和侵犯人身(罪)；袭击和暴力伤害(罪)
严重暴行，加重暴行，严重侵犯他人身体
猥亵(罪)；猥亵侵犯他人身体

partsOfSpeech.dec: as 加强 + sail〔= sal〕跳 → 跳来跳去打你 → 攻击
as 加强 + sault〔= sult〕跳 → 跳起来扣杀 → 进攻
de 离开 + sult 跳 + ory 有…性质的，属于…的，与…有关的 → 跳向四面八方 → 散漫的
ex 加强 + ult〔= sult〕跳 →〔高兴地〕跳起来 → 欢腾
in 使… + sult 跳 → 使跳到〔别人脸上〕→ 侮辱〔别人〕
re 一再 + sili〔= sal〕跳 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 能反复跳起来 → 有弹性的
re 回 + sult 跳 → 跳回来的东西 → 结果
sali〔= sal〕跳 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 跳出来的 → 显著的
sal 跳 + ute → 跳着欢呼 → 向…致意

rootsaffixes.indicate: 等加在同辅音字母的词根前, 表加强
rootsaffixes.title: ab-, ac-, af-, ag-, ap-, ar-, as-, at-

partsOfSpeech.dec: ab 表加强 + brev 短 + iate 使… → 使一再变短 → 缩写
ac 表加强 + celer 速度 + ate 使… → 加快速度 → 加速
ac 表加强 + cent 唱歌 + uate 使… → 不停地唱 → 强调
ac 表加强 + company 伙伴 → 陪伴
ac 表加强 + cumul 堆积 + ate 做，造成，使… → 不断堆积 → 积累
af 表加强 + fili 子女 + ation 表结果 → 成为子女 → 入会
ag 表加强 + glomer 球状物 + ate 做，造成，使… → 成球状 → 成团
ag 表加强 + grand 大 + ize 使… → 一再大 → 扩大
ag 表加强 + grav 重 + ate 做，造成，使… →〔病〕加重 → 恶化
ag 表加强 + gress 行走 + ion 动作或状态 → 往前走 → 进攻
ap 表加强 + peas 平和 + e → 使〔人〕心态平和 → 抚慰
ap 表加强 + plaus 鼓掌 + e → 鼓掌
ap 表加强 + point 指 → 指定
ap 表加强 + preci 价值 + ate 做，造成，使… → 一再指出价值 → 欣赏
ar 表加强 + range 列 → 成列 → 安排
ar 表加强 + rest 休息 → 强制休息 → 逮捕
as 表加强 + sault 跳 → 跳起来〔争球〕→ 进攻
as 表加强 + sid 坐 + uous …的 → 一再坐着〔学习〕→ 勤奋的
as 表加强 + simil 一样 + ate 做，造成，使… → 成为相同 → 同化
as 表加强 + sist 站 → 站在一起 → 帮助
as 表加强 + soci 社会 + ate 做，造成，使… → 成为一个社会 → 联合
as 表加强 + sure 确定 → 一再确定 → 肯定
at 表加强 + tach 钉 → 牢牢钉上 → 附上
at 表加强 + tain 拿住 → 获得
at 表加强 + test 试验 → 一再试验 → 证实
at 表加强 + tract 拉 → 不断拉〔眼球〕→ 吸引
